intro: Erythrobalanus duqueana, commonly known as the Duque's redwood, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, red-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, Erythrobalanus duqueana is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
